author: Epoch Times Staff
description: A glimpse into the world through the lens of photography.
title: Day in Photos: Trump Meets Zelenskyy, Explosion in Romania, and Student Protest

author: Autumn Spredemann
description: As voters wait in line for fuel, many worry about the effects on Sunday's election while looking for transportation alternatives to reach polling stations.
title: Fuel Crisis in Bolivia Spurs Voter Fears Ahead of Historic Runoff Election

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney is scheduled to visit Malaysia, Singapore, and South Korea next week with the objective of boosting Canadian exports and strengthening defence and economic alliances. Carney will meet with the leaders of all three nations on his trip and will attend the Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN) Summit from Oct. 26 […]
title: Carney to Travel to Asia Next Week to Work On Trade, Defence Partnerships

author: Noé Chartier
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney says he has learned a great deal from U.S. President Donald Trump, including the effectiveness of initiating a flurry of political activity. Carney discussed his rise to power as well as his relationship with Trump during an interview with Bloomberg’s Mishal Husain. “I’ve learned lots of things from President Trump,” Carney […]
title: Carney Says He Learned a Lot From Trump, Including Value of ‘Flooding the Zone’

author: Nathan Worcester
description: George Abaraonye once debated Charlie Kirk at the Oxford Union. He could face a vote of no confidence as its leader.
title: Student Who Celebrated Kirk Shooting May Be Ousted as Leader of Top Debate Group

author: Carolina Avendano
description: Human rights and civil society groups are urging Ottawa to maintain tariffs on Chinese-made electric vehicles (EVs), saying that allowing them into the Canadian market could pose national security risks.  Pro-democracy group Saskatchewan Stands with Hong Kong issued a press release on Oct. 16, calling on the federal government to maintain its tariffs on Chinese […]
title: Rights Groups Urge Ottawa to Maintain Chinese EV Tariffs Amid Canola Dispute

author: The Canadian Press
description: Governor Tiff Macklem says the Bank of Canada will have to be “humble” in its return to formal economic forecasting as trade uncertainty continues to swirl. The central bank intends to publish a forecast for the economy at its upcoming interest rate decision on Oct. 29—something it hasn’t done since the start of this year […]
title: Bank of Canada Will Be ‘Humble’ as It Returns to Economic Forecasts: Macklem

author: Ryan Morgan
description: The president's comments follow reports that U.S. forces recovered two individuals who survived a U.S. strike in the Caribbean Sea on Oct. 16.
title: Trump Says US Forces Attacked Drug-Carrying Submersible Vessel

author: Andrew Moran
description: Trump says the United States is in a 'strong position' in trade negotiations with China.
title: Bessent to Hold Bilateral Talks With Chinese Delegation in Malaysia

author: Josh Spasaro
description: The performer says she is being misunderstood due to her views on the Hamas-Israel conflict.
title: Turned Me Into a Monster: Singer on Living With Anti-Semitism in Australia

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: The union representing striking public service workers in B.C. says it will begin non-binding talks with the province to work on resolving their ongoing labour dispute. The strike began when workers walked off the job on Sept. 2. The talks with the B.C. government will be led by mediators Amanda Rogers and Vince Ready, the […]
title: BC Public Service Workers Agree to Non-Binding Mediation With Province After Striking for 7 Weeks

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: An independent probe into Alberta Health Services (AHS) has found no wrongdoing on the part of Premier Danielle Smith or government officials, but concludes that serious mismanagement at AHS led to potential conflicts of interest and a lack of transparency. The investigation, conducted by former Manitoba chief judge Raymond Wyant, combed through more than two […]
title: Third-Party Review of Alberta Health Contracting Affair Finds Organization Breached Its Own Rules

author: Matthew Horwood
description: Public Safety Minister Gary Anandasangaree has announced the government will spend $617.7 million over five years to train and hire 1,000 new Canada Border Services Agency (CBSA) officers. “These people will do critical work at our borders, ensuring the smooth movement of people and goods, all the while making sure that illegal goods, guns, and […]
title: Ottawa Pledges $617M to Hire 1,000 New Border Agents

author: Carolina Avendano
description: Foreign Affairs Minister Anita Anand says she discussed trade irritants and areas of cooperation during a meeting with her Chinese counterpart in Beijing on Oct. 17. Anand and Wang discussed trade issues of “respective sensitivity,” including agriculture and agri-food products, such as Canadian canola, seafood, and meat; and Chinese products like electric vehicles (EVs), Global […]
title: Canada’s Foreign Minister Meets Chinese Counterpart During Beijing Visit

author: David Hunt, Jeff Park
description: Of major cities, none compare to Calgary’s nearly 50 percent property tax burden increase between censuses.
title: Calgary’s High Property Taxes Run Counter to the ‘Alberta Advantage’

author: The Canadian Press
description: The federal government says it can provide a $12-million loan to keep a northern Ontario paper mill from closing. Jobs Minister Patty Hajdu says in a letter to Kap Paper that the federal operating support would be an “exceptional” one-time measure. The company said late last month that it would have to idle operations at […]
title: Ottawa Says It Can Provide $12M Loan to Keep Northern Ontario Paper Mill Open

author: The Canadian Press
description: A Montreal man has pleaded guilty to making death threats against Parti Québécois Leader Paul St-Pierre Plamondon. Philippe Clément-Laberge, 42, entered his plea on Tuesday at the Montreal courthouse. The threats were made to the party leader and his family in early March 2024. St-Pierre Plamondon opened up to the public about the incident after […]
title: Montreal Man Pleads Guilty to Making Death Threats Against Parti Québécois Leader

author: Guy Birchall
description: The leaders of Russia and the United States are set to meet in Budapest on an as yet undisclosed date for negotiations to bring an end to the war in Ukraine.
title: Hungary Will Ensure Putin Can Enter Country for Trump Meeting Despite ICC Arrest Warrant

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: Three individuals were apprehended for conspiracy-related offences last week, stemming from an incident last spring where a Chinese national illegally crossed the Canadian border into the United States, the New Brunswick RCMP says. The U.S. Border Patrol informed the RCMP about the illegal border crossing that occurred near Grand Falls, N.B., on April 15, the […]
title: 3 Nabbed on Conspiracy Charges After Illegally Entering US from New Brunswick

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: York Regional Police recovered approximately $100,000 worth of jewelry and apprehended four teenage suspects following an Oct. 15 smash-and-grab robbery at a Greater Toronto Area mall. One suspect remains at large. Police have released a video of the takedown, which occurred just before 6 p.m. after a robbery at Upper Canada Mall in Newmarket. The […]
title: Police Release Video of Southern Ontario Smash-and-Grab as Search Continues for One Suspect

author: Olivia Li
description: Chinese activists have voiced concerns that Thailand is no longer a safe haven it once was for Chinese exiles, due to CCP's heavy influence in the region.
title: Pro-Democracy Activist Faces Repatriation as Beijing Tightens Grip on Dissidents in Thailand

author: Nathan Worcester
description: Some local officials were unaware of the plans before they were announced.
title: In Greenland’s Capital, Growing Danish Military Presence Sparks Concern

author: Evgenia Filimianova
description: Friedrich Merz said the EU needed a unified stock exchange to ensure that innovation and prosperity stay in Europe.
title: German Chancellor Calls for Pan-European Stock Exchange to Boost EU Competitiveness

author: Rachel Roberts
description: West Midlands Police said they have classified the Aston Villa vs Maccabi Tel Aviv fixture as high risk.
title: British PM Criticizes Birmingham Police Ban on Israeli Football Fans

author: Victoria Friedman
description: The talks mark the latest diplomatic engagement with Brazil after months of tension over what the U.S president called the 'witch hunt' against Jair Bolsonaro.
title: US, Brazil to Arrange Trump-Lula Meeting, Officials Say

author: The Canadian Press
description: The head of the Edmonton Chamber of Commerce says a provincewide teachers strike is putting a strain on businesses. Doug Griffiths says the chamber doesn’t take a side in the labour dispute, but it hopes the strike is resolved as quickly as possible. The strike is entering its ninth school day, with about 740,000 students […]
title: Chamber of Commerce Says Alberta Teachers Strike Straining Businesses

author: The Canadian Press
description: Two senior officials working at the Canada Revenue Agency say the agency surpassed its target for answering more calls from Canadians ahead of schedule. On Sept. 2, Finance Minister François-Philippe Champagne set a 100-day timeline for the CRA to fix call centre delays, putting the deadline at Dec. 11. The CRA then said it wanted […]
title: CRA Says It Has More Work to Do as Call Centre Improvement Plan Hits 50-Day Mark

author: Guy Birchall
description: The CCP has been trying to get approval to build its new base of operations in the British capital since purchasing the site near the Tower of London in 2018.
title: UK Delays Decision on Chinese ‘Super Embassy’ in London

author: Emel Akan
description: The visit comes a day after Trump said he had a 'very productive' call with Putin that lasted over two hours.
title: Trump to Host Zelenskyy at White House—Here’s What to Know

author: Andrew Thornebrooke
description: The Pentagon approved plans to build a dedicated facility for training members of the Qatar Armed Forces in Idaho.
title: What to Know About Qatar’s Training Facility in Idaho

author: PA Media
description: The Prime Minister has ordered a review of antisemitism in the NHS, saying there are too many cases “simply not being dealt with.” Sir Keir Starmer said Lord John Mann, the Government’s independent adviser on antisemitism, would lead the review as part of a wider crackdown on antisemitism in the UK. During a visit to […]
title: Starmer Orders Review of Antisemitism in NHS as Part of Wider Crackdown

author: PA Media
description: The number of written complaints submitted to the health service has risen year-on-year to a new record high, NHS England data shows. Experts said the figure should serve as a “wake-up call”. Some 256,777 complaints were made to the NHS in 2024/25, up from 241,922 a year earlier. The figure is a 6.1 percent increase […]
title: Written Complaints to NHS in England Rises to New Record High

author: PA Media
description: Britain’s economy eked out growth in August but expansion was weaker than forecast and official figures revealed a surprise contraction in July after a downward revision. The Office for National Statistics (ONS) said gross domestic product (GDP) rose by 0.1 percent month-on-month in August and fell by 0.1 percent in July, in a revision to […]
title: UK Economy Sees Weaker-Than-Expected Growth in August After July Contraction

author: PA Media
description: Scotland has the most violent classrooms in the UK, new figures have suggested. Data from a freedom of information request found the country had the highest rate of violent injuries to school staff in Britain. The figures, obtained by Channel 4 News FactCheck, showed that that between March 2014 and March 2024 there were 490 […]
title: Scotland’s Classrooms Most Violent in UK, Figures Suggest

author: PA Media
description: British spies have begun work on tackling the potential risk posed by rogue artificial intelligence (AI) systems, the head of MI5 said. Sir Ken McCallum said it would be “reckless” to ignore the potential for AI to cause harm. In a speech at the Security Service’s Thames House headquarters, he insisted he was not “forecasting […]
title: MI5 Looking at Potential Risk From Out-of-Control AI

author: PA Media
description: The verdict in the trial of a former paratrooper accused of the murder of two civilians in the Bloody Sunday shootings in Londonderry 50 years ago is expected to be delivered next week. The veteran, referred to as Soldier F for legal reasons, is accused of the murders of James Wray and William McKinney during […]
title: Judge to Deliver Verdict in Soldier F Trial Next Week

author: Cindy Li, Rachel Qu
description: Yang has drawn widespread speculation about her identity, with one Canada-based journalist speculating she may be linked to CCP leadership.
title: 3rd Hearing for Young Chinese Heiress Ends in Delay as Questions Mount Over Identity

author: PA Media
description: A new national clock design for Britain’s railways has been created for the first time in more than half a century. Network Rail launched the design by unveiling a 1.8-metre diameter digital clock at London Bridge station on Thursday. The blueprint was selected out of more than 100 competition entries. It will also appear in […]
title: Railways Get First National Clock Design in 51 Years

author: PA Media
description: Children made up a fifth of terror suspects arrested last year, the head of MI5 said, as he launched a new centre to tackle the problem of youngsters drawn to extremist violence. Sir Ken McCallum said terrorism “breeds in squalid corners of the internet” but the online world could also blur people’s motives, making it […]
title: One-in-Five Terror Arrests Last Year Was a Child Under 17, MI5 Chief Says

author: Rex Widerstrom
description: One year after strong recovery in the China market, the country’s slowing economy and falling retail demand are hitting even premium brands like Penfolds.
title: Penfolds Maker Warns of China Sales Slowdown as Demand Weakens

author: Rex Widerstrom
description: The 70,000-tonne steel platform has been made in Shandong and will be floated to the coast off Western Australia.
title: 70,000-Tonne China-Built Gas Platform for Woodside Set to Arrive Later This Year

author: The Associated Press
description: SEATTLE—Max Scherzer turned back the clock with a vintage pitching performance and Andrés Giménez homered and drove in four runs as the Toronto Blue Jays beat the Seattle Mariners 8-2 on Thursday to even the American League Championship Series at two games apiece. Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hit his fifth homer this postseason and the 41-year-old […]
title: Scherzer Turns Back the Clock and Blue Jays Beat Mariners 8-2 in Game 4 to Even ALCS

author: Crystal-Rose Jones
description: A woman stabbed in an unprovoked attack in Melbourne's city centre now lives in fear.
title: Victorian Leaders Respond to Daylight Stabbing of Sushi Chef

author: Crystal-Rose Jones
description: The motion passed the council's ordinary meeting with two parts removed on Oct. 13.
title: Parramatta Council Moves to Back Indian Australians Following Senator Price Comments

author: Monica O’Shea
description: 'If leaders care about women’s safety, they’ll follow the NT’s lead,' says Women's Forum CEO Rachael Wong.
title: Woman’s Forum Calls on Australian States to Ban Transgender Inmates From Women’s Prisons

author: Arjun Singh
description: The legislation would require 500 percent tariffs on any country that buys oil or uranium from Russia, apart from imposing other sanctions on officials.
title: Senate to Consider Legislation Expanding Russia Sanctions, Tariffs

author: Chandra Philip
description: Health Canada is recalling a brand of tankless water heaters over carbon monoxide poisoning risks. The Vesta brand’s VRP and VRS model water heaters are said to have an exhaust duct that can crack, according to an Oct. 16 Health Canada notice. This can allow gases to escape and get into the home, posing a […]
title: Health Canada Recalls Vesta Tankless Water Heaters Over Carbon Monoxide Poisoning Risk

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: RCMP Commissioner Mike Duheme says the force acts independent of politicians, rejecting accusations by the Conservatives that RCMP management acted under political pressure by the Liberal government when it came to the issue of the SNC-Lavalin scandal. Speaking at a press conference alongside Prime Minister Mark Carney in Toronto on Oct. 16, Duheme also responded […]
title: RCMP Commissioner Rejects Conservative Accusation of Political Interference

author: Monica O’Shea
description: Since 2020, bank branches have declined nearly 33 percent with ATMs dropping 46.5 percent.
title: Physical Bank Services Fall Another 4.6 Percent Across Australia, APRA Finds

author: Nicole James
description: Holy Basil, or Tulsi is worshipped as a goddess and revered by Ayurvedic practitioners.
title: From Temples to Teacups. Discover the 3,000-Year-Old Sacred Leaf That Rejuvenates Body and Soul

author: Carolina Avendano
description: Prince Edward Island’s government is calling for federal probes into allegations of foreign interference and money laundering in the province, following revelations from an investigation detailing how Beijing exploited immigration loopholes and used elite capture to infiltrate the island. P.E.I. Premier Rob Lantz sent a letter to RCMP Commissioner Michael Duheme on Oct. 16, requesting […]
title: PEI Premier Calls for RCMP Probe Following Revelations of Beijing’s Influence Operations in the Province

author: Oren Shalom
description: Avinatan Or tried to escape, Eitan Mor spoke with a Hamas leader, and Yosef Haim Ohana heard his father’s voice on the radio from the tunnels.
title: Families of Released Hostages Reveal First Details: ‘It’s a Miracle’ They Came Back Alive

author: Mark A. Kellner
description: The wave of arrests comes amid new regulations issued last month banning unauthorized online preaching, 'foreign collusion,' and unsanctioned clergy training.
title: China’s Arrests of House Church Pastors Draw Sharp US Response
